column4: Hello everyone.  After performing a usual apt-get update/upgrade this morning, my laptop with an ATI graphics card using the open-source drivers on ubuntu 11.10 is running incredibly slowly.  Can anyone help?
Everything.  Moving windows, typing in the terminal
etc
I believe it's all X related
The mouse is responding quickly
but that's about it
Really??  The update manager doesn't really warn you that things might be unusable after just updating your packages.. :[
I guess one of my main questions is whether I should be using the open source drivers at all.. with my last laptop I had to use fglrx
But I was humming along fine with the open source drivers until 20 minutes ago
maybe "top" is showing what is causing a high load?
overall cpu usage is very low, but X is using almost 90%
any hints in the xorg.log?
is this also in the logs before you did the upgrade?
looks like it, yes
ok then i dont think its the issue
I'm thinking I should try the proprietary AMD driver
what is the package-name of the open-source driver you are using?
maybe "apt-get changelog packagename" has some usefull infos
last changed 11.08.2011
both
